title: Deformations and gluing of asymptotically cylindrical associatives. (arXiv:2209.00156v2 [math.DG] UPDATED)
description: We introduce a method to construct closed rigid (unobstructed) associatives in the twisted connected sum $G_2$-manifolds [Kov03, KL11, CHNP15]. The method is based on gluing asymptotically cylindrical (ACyl) associatives in ACyl $G_2$-manifolds under a hypothesis which can be interpreted as a transverse Lagrangian intersection condition. This is analogous to the gluing theorem for $G_2$-instantons introduced in [SW15]. We rewrite the hypothesis for ACyl associatives obtained from ACyl holomorphic curves or ACyl special Lagrangian $3$-folds in ACyl Calabi-Yau $3$-folds. This helps us to construct many new associatives which are diffeomorphic to $S^3$, $\mathbf R \mathbf P^3$ or $\mathbf R \mathbf P^3\# \mathbf R \mathbf P^3$. We also study the deformation theory of ACyl associatives and define their moduli space with a natural topology and prove that the moduli space is locally homeomorphic to the zero set of a smooth map between two finite dimensional spaces.
